definition: to fan into a flame/to incite
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: They were licensing, taxation , and seditious libel.
sentences.chinese: 它們是許可證，稅收和煽動性誹謗。

sentences.english: He sticked provocative poster on board when nobody was looking.
sentences.chinese: 趁無人注意，他在板上貼了具有煽動性的海報。

sentences.english: At a time of famine, it was an inflammatory statement.
sentences.chinese: “在饑荒時期”，是一種煽動性的說法。

sentences.english: The Information Bureau will prohibit some subversive publications.
sentences.chinese: 新聞局將禁止煽動性刊物。

sentences.english: How does one write a motivational speech that actually motivates?
sentences.chinese: 我們該怎樣寫一篇真正有煽動性的煽動演說詞呢？

sentences.english: Our inflammatory cytokines go up and down.
sentences.chinese: 我們的煽動性的細胞因子升高和降低。

sentences.english: He was charged with making inflamatory speeches.
sentences.chinese: 他被控發表了煽動性講話。
